content: Who was the Greek philosopher and student of Socrates, who founded the Academy in Athens and wrote philosophical dialogues featuring his teacher?

The philosopher you're referring to is Plato. He was a student of Socrates and went on to establish the Academy in Athens, which was one of the earliest institutions of higher learning in the Western world. Plato's works primarily take the form of dialogues, in which Socrates often plays the central role engaging in philosophical discussions with various interlocutors. These dialogues cover a wide range of philosophical topics including ethics, politics, metaphysics, and epistemology.
